About Me

Building at the Intersection
of Strategy & Healthcare

I'm a Strategic Management student at BYU's Marriott School of Business with a deep passion for healthcare innovation. My work bridges business strategy, data analytics, and product development—helping organizations solve complex problems and create meaningful change.

From pioneering the Big XII Healthcare Leadership Case Competition to driving 5x growth in buyer identification at an AI startup, I thrive at the intersection of strategic thinking and hands-on execution. My international experience studying health systems across 8 European countries has shaped my perspective on building inclusive, patient-centered solutions.

Strategy & Consulting Product Development Healthcare Innovation Data Analytics Leadership Cross-Cultural Communication

International Experiences

9 countries, countless perspectives. Studying health systems across Europe was one of the most eye-opening experiences of my life.

Switzerland

Taking the leap—jumping off a mountain was terrifying but incredibly rewarding.

Norway

Finding my edge on the fjords.

Norway

Simply breathtaking views.

Italy

La Dolce Vita.

France

Roland Garros—a dream come true.

Big Family Energy

3rd of 12 children—family dinners are organized chaos, teaching me to work with different personalities.

Twin Life

My twin brother and I push each other to be better. We're competitive in the best way.

Tennis & Basketball

Tennis Academic All-State. Basketball Team Captain as a freshman.

Eagle Scout

First in my family to earn Eagle Scout—following through on commitments.

With 11 siblings, life is never quiet! Our family emphasizes hard work, serving others, and chasing meaningful goals.
